DOC.brief_summary: Evaluate efficacy combination therapy AEGR-733 plus atorvastatin 20 mg versus monotherapy serum lipoproteins 4 8 week therapy . The primary efficacy parameter percent change LDL-C 8 week therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate Safety Efficacy AEGR-733 Atorvastatin v Atorvastatin Monotherapy Hypercholesterolemia
DOC.detailed_description: Following 35-day washout current lipid-lowering medication ( ) adherence low-fat diet , subject receive either atorvastatin 20 mg 8 week , OR AEGR-733 2.5 mg + atorvastatin 20 mg 4 week follow AEGR-733 5 mg + atorvastatin 20 mg 4 additional week . During entire study , subject instruct follow low-fat/low cholesterol diet limit alcohol consumption -/ < 1 drink per day .
DOC.criteria: M/F 1870 01 risk factor , mean LDLC / > 160 / < 250 mg/dL ( Visit 2 & 3 ) 2+ risk factor , mean LDLC / > 130 & / < 250 mg/dL ( Visit 2 & 3 ) Fasting mean TGs / < 400 mg/dL Understanding compliance protocol sign consent Females pregnant , lactating , CBP use acceptable contraceptive method previous 3 month Uncontrolled hypertension > 180/95 screen Hx chronic renal insufficiency ( serum creatinine > 2.5 mg/dL ) Hx liver disease transaminases > 1.5 X ULN Positive Hepatitis B C Major surgery within past 3 mo Cardiac insufficiency define functional Class IIClass IV Hx malignancy within previous 5 year Participation another investigational drug study within past 6 wks Serious unstable medical psychological condition Regular alcohol use > 1 drink per day Regular consumer grapefruit juice medication know metabolized CYP 3A4 Use lipidlowering med ( washout permit ) Acute CVD Diabetes Mellitus Fasting glucose > 110 mg/dL BMI / > 40 kg/m2 Significant gastrointestinal symptom IBS Use fish oil , niacin , herbal wt . loss product ( washout permit )
